sen.j: 多 自然麿（おおの じねんまろ、生年不詳 - 仁和2年9月16日 (旧暦)（886年10月16日））は平安時代初期の雅楽の大家。
sen.e: O no Jinenmaro (birth year unknown-October 16, 886) was an expert in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) in the early Heian Period.
O no Jinenmaro (birth year unknown-October 16, 886) was an expert in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) in the early Heian Period.
O no Jinenmaro (birth year unknown - October 16, 886) was an expert in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) in the early Heian Period.

sen.j: 「おおの・しぜまろ」「おおの・じぜまろ」とも読む。
sen.e: It was also referred to as `O no Sizemaro' or `O no Jizemaro.'
He was also referred to as `O no Sizemaro' or `O no Jizemaro.'
He was also referred to as 'O no Sizemaro' or 'O no Jizemaro.'

sen.j: 神武天皇の子の神八井耳命（かむやいみみのみこと）の後裔と伝える家系に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born into a family which was told as a descendant of the child of the Emperor Jinmu, Kamuyaimimi no mikoto.
He was born into a family which was said to be a descendant of the child of the Emperor Jinmu, Kamuyaimimi no mikoto.
He was born into a family which was said to be a descendant of the child of the Emperor Jinmu, Kamuyaimimi no mikoto.

sen.j: 太安万侶（多安万呂）の子孫。
sen.e: He was a descendant of O no Yasumaro (多安万呂).
sen.cmt: 多安万呂→太安万侶と読み方は同一で登録されているため漢字の記載を残しました。
sen.e: He was a descendant of O no Yasumaro (多安万呂).
He was a descendant of O no Yasumaro (多安万呂).

sen.j: 雅楽と右舞を創始し、39年間にわたって雅楽の一者（いちのもの）の座を占め、今日まで宮中に伝わる神楽の形式を定める。
sen.e: He established gagaku and Umai (dance in the right-side), and retained the top position of gagaku for thirty nine years; he defined the form of kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines) which the present imperial court has inherited.

He established gagaku and Umai (dance in the right-side), and retained the top position of gagaku for thirty nine years; he defined the form of kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines) which the present imperial court has inherited.

He established gagaku and Umai (dance in the right-side), and retained the top position of gagaku for thirty nine years; he defined the form of kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines) which the present imperial court has inherited.

sen.j: 嘉祥元年（848年）、右近衛将監（うこんえのしょうげん）となる。
sen.e: In 848, he became a Ukone no shogen (Lieutenant of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 848, he became an Ukone no shogen (Lieutenant of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 848, he became an Ukone no shogen (Lieutenant of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 貞観 (日本)5年（863年）、宿禰（すくね）の姓（かばね）を賜わる。
sen.e: In 863, he was granted SUKUNE for his family name.
In 863, he was granted SUKUNE for his family name.
In 863, he was granted SUKUNE for his family name.

sen.j: 子孫は現代に至るまで楽人の家として宮廷に仕え、数多の雅楽家を輩出した。
sen.e: His descendants have served the imperial court as a musician until today, many of his descendants turned out to be a gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music).
His descendants have served the imperial court as a musician until today, many of his descendants turned out to be a gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music).
His descendants have served the imperial court as a musician until today, many of his descendants turned out to be a gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music).

sen.j: その中には、多忠亮（おおの・ただすけ）のようにクラシック音楽の世界で活躍した者や、多忠修（おおの・ただおさ）のようにジャズの世界に進んだ者もいる。
sen.e: Among them, O no Tadasuke who was active in classic music, and O no Tadaosa who became a Jazz player.
Among them, O no Tadasuke who was active in classic music, and O no Tadaosa who became a Jazz player.
Among them, O no Tadasuke who was active in classic music, and O no Tadaosa who became a Jazz player.
